inn1.comm: Two slips watch as Anderson starts off with a outswinger which is left alone by Gibbs.
a touch short in length and moving away from the off stump, Gibbs was momentarily interested in playing it before he withdrew his bat from the line
short in length and outside off stump, left alone. A tad wide and a touch short, so far.

Loud appeal for a caught-behind decision. No wood on leather, though. Lovely delivery that. It was fuller in length, closer to the off stump and shaped away. Gibbs pushed inside the line and was beaten.
even fuller, around off and middle and Gibbs pushes it past the bowler for the first runs of the morning. He didn't go hard at it, just a mere push.
short in length, bouncing towards hips and tucked past square leg for a single.
lands well outside off and moving away, left alone.
edged to the third man boundary. Full and well outside the off stump, Amla is leaden footed but has a go at it and gets a thickish edge past second slip. Pietersen claps.
closer to the off stump, full in length and shaping away, left alone
87.4 mph delivery homing in on the off stump, Amla leans forward, opens the bat face to guide to point region.
85.6 probing full delivery around the middle and off line, Amla choses to play it to the on side- not a wise decision under this swinging conditions - and gets a leading edge to covers
on a length, coming in with bounce on the middle, Amla tries to work it to the leg side, misses and is hit high on the thigh pad.
89.0 mph full delivery outside off stump, Gibbs doesn't move his feet, just lunges forward at the last minute to dab it to the off side
87.7 mph back-of-length delivery outside off stump, punched down the track and Anderson lunges to his right to stop
short in length and outside off stump, Gibbs goes back to push it to covers.
Even more short and Gibbs rocks back to pull it through wide midwicket region. He is bowling too short, especially under these swinging conditions.
on a length this time, Gibbs presses back to push it to the off side.
88.7 mph length delivery, landing outside off stump and moving away, Gibbs covers his off stump and lets it swing past him
85.1 mph full in length and outside off stump, holding its line, Amla leans across to push it to covers
86.7 mph full delivery outside off stump and holds its line, Amla went for the off drive, pushing his bat outside the line and edges it to his pad
drifting in towards middle and leg and Amla clips it past the short midwicket fielder for his second boundary
sprays down leg and neither Amla or the diving Prior could reach it.
full in length and outside off stump - the line and length to bowl here - and Amla squeezes it off the outer half of the bat to point
back of length, coming in towards middle, tries to whip it to across and is struck on the thigh. Samit Patel moves in from midwicket to pick the ball
full and outside off, 86.1 mph delivery, Amla is caught at the crease but has a go at it and edges it to mid-on.
lovely looking straight drive. It was a pretty full delivery on the middle and off line, Gibbs took out the left leg from the line and drives down the ground. Again just a push.
Creamed through covers. Width outside off and Gibbs square drove on the up and through cover point... 29 all ready
90.6 mph delivery sliding in towards the pad, Gibbs can't connect with his flick and the ball rolls off the pad to the on side. Pietersen has a chat with Anderson
Stunning hit. It was a length delivery outside off stump and Gibbs drove on the up and through cover point. No foot movement but he shifted his weight very well.
SA rattle along. On the middle and leg line, from a length and Gibbs wrists it through midwicket
87.9 mph in cutter from just outside off, cuts Amla into half and it raps him high on the thigh pad
full in length and curving away at 84.4 mph and Gibbs edges it down to third man. He was looking to ping covers.
leans forward to drive to covers.
length delivery outside off stump and driven to covers
85.9 mph short-pitched delivery outside off stump, Amla tries to upper cut it but can't connect.
holds the ball across the seam and bangs it in short again and Amla ducks to evade
another short delivery, lifting shoulder-high around the off stump, Amla hops back to keep it down close on the off side.
starts outside off on a length and holding its line, left alone
swing and a miss. In the channel outside off, Gibbs tried to force it off the back foot but couldn't connect
86 mph fullish delivery outside off stump and Gibbs lets it fly past him
87.4 mph length delivery whizzing past the off stump, left alone by Gibbs.
coming in towards the off stump from a length, Gibbs gets behind the line to push it to the off side.  Pietersen runs in from mid-off to field
outswing from Harmison and well outside off stump but Gibbs stretches across to scoop it over cover point.
Amla starts off with a lovely crispy on-the-up square drive. It was short in length and outside off stump, Amla let it come to him before opening the blade and punching it through cover point
fuller, closer to the off stump, Amla moves across to defend to covers
four more. Runs coming thick and fast. This one drifted to the legs and Amla tickles it to fine-leg boundary.
length delivery around the off stump and guided to backward point. SA 49 for 0. Super start.
leans forward to push a length delivery to mid-off, thinks about a single, takes couple of steps down the track but changes his mind.
bouncing from short in length, Amla goes back to tap it close on the leg side and this time rushes across for a quick single. Luke Wright rushed in from midwicket and flicked it over the stumps
More runs. Short and wide, Amla went for the square cut and it flew to the third man boundary. 54 for 0
Even better. It was a lifting delivery from short of length outside off, Amla hopped to punch it through cover point. Superbly played.
fuller in length, around the off stump and Amla leans forward to defend

Crashing square drive on the up. This is fabulous strokeplay from the South Africans. Again, not a bad delivery - short in length and outside off stump, Amla spanked it on the up and through cover point. The only criticism of the bowling is that it has been a touch short in length and some width offered outside off.
corrects his length- fuller in length and around the off stump, defended down the track
Flamboyant square drive from the wristy Amla. It was full in length but width offered outside off stump and Amla fisted it on the up. Wonderful bat speed

Shah gets Amla run out with a direct hit. Gibbs had charged down the track and mistimed a shot past the bowler and set off with the stroke. The ball went behind the stumps and Shah came across from mid-on. Amla was very late in responding and tried to run down the track between the stumps and the throw but the ball beat him to crash into the stumps at the striker's end. Against the run of play, a wicket has fallen. Amla was caught ball watching there. Gibbs looks very surprised and stares long and hard at Amla. Very good effort from Shah, he picked it with his left hand, swung around as he passed the ball to the right and fired down the stumps
length delivery on the of and middle line, defended on the front foot
cutting in from just outside off stump, from a length and Kallis shoulders arms and the ball flies over the off stump line
similar delivery and Kallis again lets it go on the length.
holds its line outside off stump this time and left alone again.
beaten outside off stump. Again darting away from Kallis who stabs at it.
top shot, he gets room and drives out to deep cover, where Patel cant get there
back of a length, some swing in, and he leaves it be
fuller, swings in, he mistimes it and edges to fine leg

massive wicket, and an even bigger controversy looming here. Kallis swishes loosely outside off to a ball that nips off the seam, and appears to beat the bat. Prior claims a comfortable edge and appeals, and Simon Taufel - after a consultation with his colleague - refers the decision upstairs. The third umpire, Ian Gould, can only adjudicate on whether the ball carried, not whether there was an edge or not. And so, Kallis has to go. And he is livid ...   But the snickometer shows there was an edge.
gets off the mark first ball with a flick past midwicket
wide down the leg side
full but down leg stumps, he tries to flick but it clips his shin
full length, outside off and te ball bursts through to the keeper to complete an eventful over
marginally short of a length and Gibbs goes for a pull and drags it down into the ground in front of midwicket, de Villiers scrambles down the other end, Gibbs wants the second now
leans forward to push to the off side
Shot! Short in length and Gibbs rocks back to pull it over midwicket. 40 from 32 balls.
length delivery around off stump, pushed to the off side
full pitched outside off stump and Gibbs presses his back leg back and across, opens his stance to square drive it powerfully to left of deep point
fuller, closer to the off, driven to mid-off
leans forward to jab a bouncing delivery
walks down and across, towards the off stump line, tries to work a delivery from short of length to the leg side and it runs off the pads
outside off stump, run down to third man
beauty. It cut back in sharply to thread the bat and pad gap and went over the stumps
outside the off stump line ,left alone
beaten by the delivery holding its line outside off. Again he walked down and across towards off and shaped to defend a length delivery but pushed inside the line
floated outside off stump, steered to backward point
leans across to drive to sweeper cover
leans across to push to covers
a tad slower and de Villiers is early into the drive and it spins away to get the edge and runs through vacant slip cordon
comes in with the angle, with the arm and Gibbs gets a inside edge to the pad
cutting in at 87.3 mph from outside off stump, beats the defensive prod and strikes the thigh pad
shout for lbw but the height was in question. Again, sharp movement inside to beat the defensive prod but it was going well above the middle stump

over pitched on the middle, trying to trap him lbw and de Villiers arrests his front-foot movement to whip it through midwicket. Pietersen with the chase and pushes the ball back in with a sliding effort
full in length, around the off stump, eased to long-off for a single
walks down the track, Flintoff drags back the length and de Villiers defends to the on side
87.7 mph length delivery moving in towards the off stump, pushed back to Flintoff
arm ball from round the stumps, tapped close on the off side
fuller, on the middle, stays inside the line to drive inside-out to long-off for a single
comes down the track, the ball dips on him and he jabs it down the track
floated outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover for a single
slower, bit more air but it's a low dipping full toss and Gibbs eases it to long-on
lands around off and middle, drifts towards middle, driven back to Samit
lands on a length around off stump, moves away, run down to third man. 100 up for SA
full in length, on the middle, turned to Pietersen at  midwicket
full and on the off stump line, driven powerfully to Bell at extra cover
very interesting shot. It was on a length and on the middle and off line, de Villiers brought his bottom-hand into play and sort of whipped it, chipped it across the line over midwicket
dabs to third man for a single. On 49 now.
slower, full and outside off stump, hint of outswing, driven to long-off
comes down the track and drives inside-out over extra cover for couple of runs
drifting on to the leg and middle, turned straight to short midwicket
outside off, driven to the off side of the pitch and Samit dives to his left to make the stop
this time driven wider of the bowler, down to long-off for a single
fifty up for Gibbs. He leaned forward to tap a flighted delivery to cover point. Graeme Smith applauds from the pavilion and the crowd too give him a warm hand
leans forward to drive to long-off for a single

loud shout for lbw but Taufel turns it down. It landed back of length outside off, cut in a bit to beat the waft across the line and hit him high on the pad in front of the off stump. It would have gone over the stump
slower, on the off stump line, worked to short straight midwicket where Pietersen has stationed himself
cutting in towards middle, punched down to long-on for another single
leans forward, waits for the length delivery to come to him, opens the bat face and runs it deftly towards third man where Harmison fails to pick the ball cleanly
full in length and straight, pushed back to Colly
full in length and drifting to the pads, misses the flick and it rolls away to the on side. de Villiers sets for the single and has to get back as Gibbs is no mood to indulge in suicide.
comes down the track and lunges across to defend tto covers
swiped straight to deep midwicket. Samit Patel gets into the act. It was floated on the off,  de Villiers cleared the front foot and went for the slog sweep but straight to the man in the deep.
leans forward to push to extra cover
comes in with the arm, Gibbs leans to defend and edges it to his pad
goes back to nurdle a short-of-length skidder to square leg
flat and quick, on the off stump line, defended to the on side of the pitch
beaten outside off stump. Full and holding its line outside off, Gibbs thought it was the off cutter and pushed inside the line, trying to tap a single to cover point
on the middle and off, worked to Pietersen at short and straightish midwicket
fuller, on the middle, dabbed to Pietersen, who smiles.
quicker, short in length, straight on the middle, nudged back down the track
slower, fuller, the off cutter, outside off, pushed through covers for a single
beaten outside off stump. It cut away from the stumps and he had a lame poke
drifting in towards off and middle, tapped to on side
leans forward to defend to the leg side.
pushed through quicker, fuller, around off, driven past extra cover and Broad rushes in from the deep
slower, around off, skips down the track and turns it straight to short midwicket
moves across to wrist the ball past square leg, think about the second but Shah kills that thought
flatter, quicker, on the middle, turned past square leg for a single
goes down on his knee to sweep a full length slow off cutter to the left of short fine leg
short in length and lapped around the corner to deep backward square leg where Anderson fields and fires in an accurate throw to Prior
short in length, on the middle and off, Duminy gets back and across to wrist it down to square leg for a single
short in length outside off stump, stops a touch on Gibbs who is early into the forcing stroke and ends up swatting it towards mid-off
full in length, on the middle stump line, worked straight to Bell at short midwicket
length delivery outside off stump, stays back, tries to run it down to third man but can't beat backward point
jumps down the track to drive powerfully inside out to Broad at sweeper cover
slower, bit more air, loopier, pushed down the track
quicker, flatter, outside off, tapped to cover point
from round the stumps, full and just outside off stump, driven back to Samit
quicker, shorter in length, drifting towards middle and leg, swung to right of deep backward square leg
slower but ends up as a full toss but Gibbs just pushes it through to long-on.
Cheeky little paddle sweep. He pressed his front leg across outside off and helped the back-of-length delivery around the corner
fuller, ends up as a low full toss, driven to Wright at long-off
moves across to the off side and swings a full pitched delivery across the line and just short of Ian Bell who makes a fine stop at short midwicket
banged in short and Duminy pulls it to the backward square leg boundary where Flintoff makes a tumbling effort but in vain.
full in length, outside off stump, mistimes a drive to covers for a single
full and straight, driven to long-on for a single
comes down the track and drags the heave to the on side
Duminy breaks free with a lofted hit down the ground. He charged down the track to force it up and over long-off
turned to short midwicket
The reverse sweep. He swung around to slap it through backward point.
comes down the track, almost yorks himself and digs it out back to the bowler
flat and quicker, on the middle, turned past square leg, Pietersen with the sliding effort and the throw but Duminy is home
Ouch! Gibbs loses sight of the full toss, ducks and is hit on the thigh pad. Kallis would know that feeling.
Flintoff takes out Duminy. He backed outside leg and went for the slog across the line but skied it up and was caught by Bell at short midwicket
goes for the yorker, a low dipping full toss results, stabbed to the on side for a single
beaten outside off. It landed on a length and held its line outside off, Boucher pushed inside the line
87.2 mph full length delivery around off stump, driven to Wright at mid-off
88.7 mph full length delivery around middle and off, driven to long-off for a single
gets back to dab a length delivery outside off to Shah at third man

Gibbs shuffles right across the stumps and tries to flick the full length delivery outside off over short fine leg but fails to connect and it ricochets of the thigh pad on to the stumps. Fine innings from Gibbs.
full in length and homing in on the off stump, defended to the off side
fullish, drifting down the leg side, misses the flick and it goes off the pad and Prior makes a diving half-stop
full and on the off stump, driven hard to the right of mid-off where Anderson not only makes a diving stop but had a shy at the non-striker's end. It would have been very interesting had he he hit
shuffles across to flick to the on side but misses and is struck on the pad, outside off stump.
bouncing from short of length towards the hips and they cross over for a leg bye
moves towards the off stump, shuffles across but fails to connect with the flick
full pitched, driven towards mid-off and they set off immediately for the risky run but the fielder doesn't pick it cleanly
short in length, pulled away for a single
banged in short, he was on the front foot, shifts his weight back to pull it to right of Pietersen at midwicket and Broad covers up in the deep
yorker on the off stump line, dug out to the off side of the pitch and Flintoff picks it up. Loud cheers from the crowd.
full pitched, on driven for a single
from wide of the crease, a slower one, a low full toss, swatted towards mid-off,
right up there, on the off stump line, Boucher can only jab it out to long-off
Again pretty full and around off stump, just short of the blockhole, dug out back to the bowler. Again the crowd appreciate the effort of the bowler
full pitched, outside off, down on a knee but can only drive straight to long-off.
low dipping full toss well outside off stump, Boucher lunges across to connect and gets it well to the right of sweeper cover
the short-pitched delivery and Philander goes for the pull and connects well. Broad throws in a desperate dive near the boundary but can't reach it

fuller in length, around off stump, Philander went for the lofted shot, got too much under the ball and immediately realised he is going to hole out; put his head down as he scampered across and his gut feeling was spot on. Straight to long-off.
low dipping full toss on the middle, the attempted yorker, Boucher takes out the front leg from the line and swiped it to midwicket
full pitched on the off stump line, pretty full, pushed inside out to extra cover
backs to the leg side and drives to wide long-off
full and outside off, tried to swipe across the line, misses and will pick a leg bye. Point of impact was just outside off.
very full outside off stump, Botha tries to paddle it away but misses

inn2.comm: lands outside off stump and veers further away, left alone. 137 to win from 119 balls.
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
first runs with a steer past backward point and Amla comes around from third man
fuller, just outside off stump, hint of outswing, around 90 mph, driven back to the bowler
leans across to push the outswinger to covers. 135 to win from 115 balls
length delivery shaping away from the off stump, Bell gets close to the line to push towards mid-on for a quick single
81.8 mph short of length delivery, Bell went for the pull, got a bottom edge but doesn't carry to BOucher
fuller and outside off stump, Bell walks into the drive to push the ball towards mid-off
cutting in from outside off stump, from back of length, Bell tries to force it away and edges it to the on side
84.1 mph delivery shaping away after landing a tad wide outside off stump, left alone
83.5 mph sharp and well-directed bouncer around the off stump line, Prior sways away in time
81. mph cutting in from just outside off stump, Prior tries to tuck it to the on side and is struck on the thigh pad
backs away to the leg side and square drives a full length delivery around off stump to deep backward point region. Amla comes around to make a fine diving stop
And the first wicket is down. Prior moves outside leg stump and has a big swing across the line but can only nick the short-of-length delivery on the middle and off line to Boucher
length delivery shaping away from the off stump line, Shah is squared up a touch but adjusts to steer it to backward point
shuffles right across the sticks, outside off stump, Steyn follows him with a full delivery and Shah is hit on the pad
87.9 mph bouncer sailing harmlessly outside off and too high
fuller, lands outside the off stump and curves away, left alone
full pitched outside off stump, driven to mid-off where Philander swoops on the ball and fires in a direct hit at the non-striker's end. It's referred upstairs and the replays suggest he is just in..
slips it wide down the leg side
cutting in with bounce, from outside off stump, Shah, waiting with his bat raised in the air at stumps-height, pushes it to the onside of the pitch
presses back to push a length delivery to left of mid-off
comes down the wicket, moving outside leg in the process and has a big swing, aiming to go inside-out over the off-side field, but misses
short in length, just outside off stump, Bell stays adjacent to the line to push it to wide third-man region.
full and swinging but well outside the off stump and Taufel extends his arms
walks outside off stump, Nel shortens the length and follows Bell and cramps him with a 78mph incutter. Defended to the on side.
83.4 mph delivery cutting into the off stump  from back of length, Bell backs away a bit and punches it straight to point. he then suggests he should have pulled it.

lots of action out there. Shah went for the pull and is hit on the inner thigh. The ball rolls to the leg side and they rush across for a quick single. Morne breaks the stumps at the striker's end but Bell is home
The first boundary of the chase comes in the fifth over. He skipped down the track, moving outside leg stump and carved a short-of-length delivery over backward point.
The openers are back in the hutch. Bell  moves outside leg stump, Morne keeps it full and outside off and Bell goes for the big swing over the offside but edges it to Boucher.
shuffles across, covers the off stump and shoulders arms.
88.5 mph, cutting in  from outside off stump to strike the thigh pad. England wobbling at 19 for 2
gets across to push a length delivery around off stump to mid-on
in that off stump channel, Shah dabs it to third man for a single. 117 from 89 balls.
It landed just short of length outside off and shaped away, KP walked into the stroke, trying to clip it across the line and is beaten
Swish and miss. Another big swing and the length delivery whizzes past the outside edge
beaten by the delivery leaving him. He drove inside the line of  the full-length delivery around the off stump.
gets well across to the off stump, opens his stance and drills a full-pitched delivery outside off straight to covers
leans across to mistime a drive to extra cover
clips the back-of-length delivery to long leg for a single.
moves outside off  stump, Morne fires it down the leg side
walks outside off stump, Morne follows him with a short-of-length delivery, fended ungainly towards mid-on and he rushes across to steal the single
Shah shapes to walk towards off and Morne pushes it well outside off and it bounces away to Boucher
fuller, outside off stump, Shah is glued to the crease, lunges out to drive and edges to pad. Where are the runs going to come from?
lovely bouncer just outside the off stump, Shah is late in picking it up and yanks his head away at the last minute
shuffles outside off stump, Morne bangs it short of length and it cuts in past the waft and flies over leg stump line.
another walk towards the off side, fails to clip to the leg side and it runs to backward point
Flat batted to the straight boundary. Shah moved outside leg and walloped it high over the non-striker's head
full in length and curving away, Shah pushes inside the line and it richochets of Boucher's thigh pad
Another miss from Boucher, standing up the stumps. Pietersen missed the big swing and Boucher clanged it
fuller, straighter, driven to mid-off

The last ball of the Powerplays has been put away to the boundary. Shah took a step  to the leg side, Philander followed him with a short-of-length delivery which was clipped over the short fine-leg fielder
Edged to the third man boundary. Short and wide, Pietersen frees his arms and gets the profitable edge.
short of length delivery on the off stump line, Pietersen pulls it to deep midwicket region where Duminy makes a tumbling stop
well outside the off stump, Pietersen thought about chasing it but killed the thought
short of length and outside off, sliced away to deep cover
Shah moves outside leg, Morne pushes it well outside off stump and Shah can't reach.
fuller, closer to the off stump and Shah walks into the square drive and pings the deep cover fielder
88.7 mph back-of-length delivery cuts in from outside off stump, Pietersen goes for the pull, misses and is hit on the waist. Pietersen yells out a cry of pain.
full pitched outside off stump, mistimed to extra cover for a single
Ah! Pietersen hits the non-striker. It was biffed down the wicket and Shah couldn't get away in time. Bang. Crash. Ouch.
clears the front foot and swings a length delivery to wide midwicket boundary. Shot a ball.
the slower one - from back of hand- well outside off, Pietersen chases it but can't connect
backs to the leg side and drives to long-off for a single.
on the middle, wristed to short fine leg and they get across for the single. The throw misses the sticks and Pietersen gets home
yorker on the stumps, Pietersen with the big swing across the line and edges it to his pad
Shah walks outside off, Kallis keeps it there and Shah can only edge the intended big swing to his pad but they rush across for the run
Pietersen threatens to jump out, Kallis drags back the length, slower as well and Pietersen smashes it over midwicket.
Fuller, outside off but it makes no difference as Pietersen kills it on the up and through extra cover.

KP is the maan for England. He clears the front foot and murders a short-of-length delivery one bounce and over the deep midwicket boundary. Kallis stands there and has a long and cold stare at KP who doesn't look at him
fuller and outside off, KP shuffles across, lunges into the off drive and edges it to the leg side for a single
Whoa. Big hit. It was short-of-length around the off and middle line and Shah went for the short-arm pull over midwicket. What a over for the hosts.
flat, turns in from outside off, dabbed to backward point region
fuller, almost yorker length, dug out back to the bowler
moves outside leg , Botha keeps it really full and on the middle and leg line, Shah edges the swipe to long leg
full and straight, driven to long-on for a single
skips down the track, Botha drags back the length and its pushed towards mid-on for a single
ha! threatens to reverse sweep, Botha keeps his calm and fires it on the middle and leg line, KP who had switched back to his orginal position could only dig it back to the bowler.
Same difference, as they say. Shah blasts a full-pitched delivery around off to wide long-on boundary
moves outside leg stump, Steyn fires in a yorker, stabbed of the inner edge to short fine-leg region
full pitched outside off, drilled to long-off
yorker on the middle stump line, Shah stays adjacent to the line and steers it through cover point. Good ball. 53 from 44 balls.
slower one, full and outside off, Pietersen reaches out to drive to Amla at sweeper cover
clipped to the on side for a single. Nine runs came in this over.
fullish, around off stump, dug out to left of covers where Gibbs makes a diving half-stop
slower, short in length, KP lunges across to get under the ball and send it soaring over wide midwicket.
low full toss, quick, driven  back to the bowler

Botha provides the breakthrough. He moves about the crease before settling for the good old slog sweep but couldn't clear Amla at deep midwicket. England's captain gets a big hand of applause from the crowd.
spins in from outside off stump, shapes to cut before dabbing it through vacant slop cordon for a single to short third man
quick, full and straight, pushed back down the track. Good over from Botha.

full in length and outside off stump and Flintoff plays a gem of a late cut. He went back and across, opened the bat face, waited for the ball to arrive before running it past backward point. Kallis has a chat with the bowler. Four men inside the ring on the off and mid-on on the leg side
Flintoff stays adjacent to the line of a length delivery and steers to third man
leans forward to push a low full toss back to the bowler.
low dipping full toss, Shah bring up the 100 with a on drive through wide midwicket region
full again, opens the bat-face to drive to Amla at sweeper cover.
What a shot! Flintoff walked down the track and flayed a length delivery through extra cover. It sped away to the boundary. The crowd roar
Shah jumps out, takes it on the full and drives to long-off
Now the crowd erupt in joy as their Freddy charges out to loft over long-on. The white ball is flying everywhere on this dark gloomy evening.
drives down the ground for a single to Andre Nel at long-on
Shah gets the crowd going again with a well-timed and more importantly, well-placed sweep shot to deep square leg
comes down the track, Botha shortens the length , Shah pushes it towards the off side of the pitch and Botha dives to stop.
down the track and on drives to deep midwicket for a single
waist-high full toss on the off and middle, Shah can only push it back to the bowler. Pietersen is chewing his nails in the pavilion.
Shah eases his captain's nerves with a off drive to wide long-off for couple of runs
low full toss outside off stump, swinging away, driven to long-off
The full tosses keep coming. Flintoff works his bottom-hand over time to swing it to cow corner.
Oh another full toss and Flintoff kills it to deep midwicket boundary.  Just 7 more.
thrusts his back foot across, opens his stance and clubs a full pitched delivery over extra cover for couple of runs
slower one, coming in, turned to midwicket for a single
Flintoff charges out and Nel fires in a bouncer and Flintoff falls on his backside to get away from that.
another short-pitched delivery, Flintoff moves outside leg, has a waft but can't connect.

That's the game. Flintoff brings up the victory with a swing to the deep backward square leg boundary. He dashed outside off, got outside the line and lapped it around the corner. England lead the series 4-0. Pietersen is all smiles in the pavilion. A glum Kallis walks out with his players. Huge cheers for Flintoff and Shah.
